description:
Gon might be a country boy, but he has high aspirations. Despite his Aunt Mito's protests, Gon decides to follow in his father's footsteps and become a legendary Hunter. The Hunter hopefuls begin their journey by storm-tossed ship, where Gon meets Leorio and Kurapika, the only other applicants who aren't devastated by bouts of seasickness.

Having survived the terrors of the high seas, Gon and his companions now have to prove their worth in a variety of tests in order to find the elusive Exam Hall. And once they get there, will they ever leave alive...?

(Source: VIZ Media)

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Cultivation
tags.description: Features characters using training, often martial arts-related, and other special methods to cultivate qi (a component of traditional Chinese philosophy, described as "life force") and gain strength or immortality.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Chimera
tags.description: Features a beast made by combining animals, usually with humans.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Death Game
tags.description: Features characters participating in a game, where failure results in death.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Gangs
tags.description: Centers around gang organizations.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: Ships
tags.description: Prominently features the use of sea-based transportation vessels.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Card Battle
tags.description: Centers around individuals competing in card games.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Mafia
tags.description: Centered around Italian organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Cannibalism
tags.description: Prominently features the act of consuming another member of the same species as food.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Asexual
tags.description: Features a character who isn't sexually attracted to people of any sex or gender.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

name.native: レオリオ・パラディナイト

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Un4v5s8bgsVk9Xp)

A Japanese manga artist. He is most notable for having created [Yu Yu Hakusho](https://anilist.co/manga/30053/Yu-Yu-Hakusho/), for which he received the Shogakukan Manga Award in 1994, and [Hunter × Hunter](https://anilist.co/manga/30026/Hunter-x-Hunter/). In 1987, Togashi received the 34th Tezuka Award, the most influential new comic artist award in Japan, for his one-shot Buttobi Straight. 

Togashi is married to [Naoko Takeuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/96946/), the creator of [Sailor Moon](https://anilist.co/manga/30092/Sailor-Moon/). His brother, [Hideaki Togashi](https://anilist.co/staff/174009/), is also a manga artist and has helped him work on his series on multiple occasions. 

Since 2006, Hunter x Hunter has gone on numerous lengthy hiatuses due to varying reasons, Including but not limited to: Togashi's struggle with Lumbago, exhaustion, and his mental health. His physical and mental health was also a leading cause in the premature conclusion of Yu Yu Hakusho.

Naoko Takeuchi is a manga artist who lives in Tokyo, Japan. Takeuchi's works are widely admired by anime/manga fans. She is a well-known mangaka in the United States. Her most popular work, Sailor Moon, has been widely reprinted and marketed in North America. She also wrote the lyrics for a number of songs featured in the Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon anime and live-action series. They are mainly character-based image songs, but do include a few theme songs. She has won several awards including the 2nd Nakayoshi Comic Prize for Newcomers, for “Yume ja Nai no Ne,” in 1985. She also won for "Love Call" which won Nakayoshi's New Artist award which debuted in the Nakayoshi Deluxe September 1986 issue. In 1993 she won the 17th Kodansha Manga Award for shoujo for Sailor Moon. She is also married to the author of Hunter x Hunter and Yu Yu Hakusho, [Togashi Yoshihiro](https://anilist.co/staff/96893).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/matsukaku)

Matsui often addressed other mangaka in his author notes during the publication of Rocket de Tsukinukero in Weekly Shonen Jump. 

His final message when his manga was cancelled was "I hate children who don't know pain. I hate adults who have lost their hearts. I like gentle manga. Bye-bye"

He is a French translator, living in Japan since 10 years. He translated many well-known manga of the authors Inio Asano and Naoki Urasawa, and received the Konishi prize in 2019 for his translation of Dead Demon Dededede Destruction.
A French letterer and touch-up artist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/marcbernabe) |  [Official Website](https://www.japonesenvinetas.com)

He is a translator and interpreter of Japanese, with special emphasis on the translation of manga and anime, a field in which he has a background of hundreds of volumes and episodes translated. In addition, he's a  specialist in didactics of the Japanese language and culture for Spanish speakers. He also has published many books about Japan and Asia.

He is famous for appearing in a Shin-chan's episode where the family goes to Spain.
Rodolphe Gicquel is a Japanese to French translator.
__Kouhei Oonishi__ is a Japanese manga magazine editor, who provides planning assistance to various works.
Former editor of the *One Piece* manga. (Arabasta through Water 7)

[Official Website](http://einfachjapanisch.de) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@Hiro) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/1fachJapanisch) | [Threads](https://www.threads.net/@einfachjapanisch) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/einfachjapanisch) | [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/einfachjapanisch) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@einfachjapanisch)

Not to be confused with the animator of the [same name](https://anilist.co/staff/158898/Hirofumi-Yamada).

Mark McMurray is a seasoned freelance artist with extensive experience in digital lettering and art retouching for notable manga publications at [VIZ Media](https://anilist.co/studio/119/Viz-Media) since February 2004.
